chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: nat
a: nat
m: list bool
l: list bool

Goal:
list_repeat One a ++ Zero :: l = list_repeat One b ++ Zero :: m -> a = b /\ l = m

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Notation One := true
Notation Zero := false
list_repeat : forall X : Type, X -> nat -> list X
list_bool_choose : forall lb : list bool, {k : nat & {tl : list bool | lb = list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: tl}} + {k : nat | lb = list_repeat Zero k}
list_bool_choose_sym : forall lb : list bool, {k : nat & {tl : list bool | lb = list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: tl}} + {k : nat | lb = list_repeat One k}
bool_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list bool) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe2
bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : list bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lH ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) Zero One bool_eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) (get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe
Permutation.Permutation_vs_cons_cons_inv : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (a b : A), l ~p a :: b :: l' -> exists l1 l2 l3 : list A, l = l1 ++ a :: l2 ++ b :: l3 \/ l = l1 ++ b :: l2 ++ a :: l3
list_repeat_plus : forall (X : Type) (x : X) (a b : nat), list_repeat x (a + b) = list_repeat x a ++ list_repeat x b
nat_sorted = fun ll : list nat => forall (l : list nat) (a : nat) (m : list nat) (b : nat) (r : list nat), ll = l ++ a :: m ++ b :: r -> a < b : list nat -> Prop Arguments nat_sorted _%list_scope
list_nat_bool = fix list_nat_bool (ln : list nat) : list bool := match ln with | nil => nil | x :: ll => list_repeat Zero x ++ One :: list_nat_bool ll end : list nat -> list bool Arguments list_nat_bool _%list_scope
app_inj_tail : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a b : A), x ++ a :: nil = y ++ b :: nil -> x = y /\ a = b
elt_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 : list A) (a b : A), l1 ++ a :: l2 = b :: nil -> a = b /\ l1 = nil /\ l2 = nil
in_lbs_0 : forall (k : nat) (l : list bool), list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l) (list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l)
map_eq_cons : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (l' : list B) (b : B), map f l = b :: l' -> exists (a : A) (tl : list A), l = a :: tl /\ f a = b /\ map f tl = l'
BoolTheory = {| Radd_0_l := fun x : bool => if x as b return ((if b then One else Zero) = b) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Radd_comm := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y : bool, xorb b y = xorb y b) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb One b = xorb b One) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb Zero b = xorb b Zero) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Radd_assoc := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y z : bool, xorb b (xorb y z) = xorb (xorb b y) z) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (forall z : bool, xorb One (xorb b z) = xorb (xorb One b) z) then fun z : bool => if z as b return (xorb One (xorb One b)...
Inductive list_bool_succ : list bool -> list bool -> Prop := in_lbs_0 : forall (k : nat) (l : list bool), list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l) (list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l) | in_lbs_1 : forall k : nat, list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k) (list_repeat Zero (S k)) Arguments list_bool_succ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lbs_0 _%nat_scope _%list_scope Arguments in_lbs_1 _%nat_scope
desc_end : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (x ++ a :: nil) /\ Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (x ++ a :: nil) (b :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.clos_trans A leA a b
list_an_duplicate_inv : forall (a n : nat) (l : list nat) (x : nat) (m : list nat) (y : nat) (r : list nat), list_an a n = l ++ x :: m ++ y :: r -> a <= x /\ x < y < a + n
Permutation.Permutation_morph_transp : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), (forall (a b : A) (l1 l2 : list A), P (l1 ++ a :: b :: l2) -> P (l1 ++ b :: a :: l2)) -> Morphisms.Proper (Morphisms.respectful (Permutation.Permutation (A:=A)) Basics.impl) P
list_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x : X), l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ x :: r2 -> {m : list X | l1 ++ m = l2 /\ r1 = m ++ x :: r2} + {m : list X | l2 ++ x :: m = l1 /\ r2 = m ++ r1}
desc_tail : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (x : list A) (a b : A), Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (b :: x ++ a :: nil) -> Relation_Operators.clos_refl_trans A leA a b
map_middle_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m : list Y) (y : Y) (n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ y :: n -> {l : list X & {x : X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ x :: r /\ map f l = m /\ f x = y /\ map f r = n}}}
in_app_or : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a (l ++ m) -> In a l \/ In a m
in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a l \/ In a m -> In a (l ++ m)
map_duplicate_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (l' : list Y) (y1 : Y) (m' : list Y) (y2 : Y) (r' : list Y), map f ll = l' ++ y1 :: m' ++ y2 :: r' -> {l : list X & {x1 : X & {m : list X & {x2 : X & {r : list X | l' = map f l /\ y1 = f x1 /\ m' = map f m /\ y2 = f x2 /\ r' = map f r /\ ll = l ++ x1 :: m ++ x2 :: r}}}}}
xorb = fun b1 b2 : bool => if b1 then if b2 then Zero else One else if b2 then One else Zero : bool -> bool -> bool Arguments xorb (_ _)%bool_scope
Permutation.Permutation_elt_map_inv : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l1 l2 l3 : list B) (l4 : list A) (a : B), l1 ++ a :: l2 ~p l3 ++ map f l4 -> (forall b : A, a <> f b) -> exists l1' l2' : list B, l3 = l1' ++ a :: l2'
list_cons_app_cons_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l2 r1 r2 : list X) (x y : X), x :: r1 = l2 ++ y :: r2 -> (l2 = nil /\ x = y /\ r1 = r2) + {m : list X | l2 = x :: m /\ r1 = m ++ y :: r2}
map_app_inv : forall (X Y : Type) (f : X -> Y) (ll : list X) (m n : list Y), map f ll = m ++ n -> {l : list X & {r : list X | ll = l ++ r /\ m = map f l /\ n = map f r}}
list_bool_invalid = fun (k : nat) (lb : list bool) (ln : list nat) => exists lc : list bool, lb = list_nat_bool ln ++ lc /\ (Exists (fun x : nat => k <= x) ln \/ Forall (fun x : nat => x < k) ln /\ (exists p : nat, lc = list_repeat Zero (S p))) : nat -> list bool -> list nat -> Prop Arguments list_bool_invalid _%nat_scope (_ _)%list_scope
list_bool_nat = fix list_bool_nat (l : list bool) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | One :: l0 => 1 + 2 * list_bool_nat l0 | Zero :: l0 => 0 + 2 * list_bool_nat l0 end : list bool -> nat Arguments list_bool_nat _%list_scope
list_app_eq_inv : forall (X : Type) (l1 l2 r1 r2 : list X), l1 ++ r1 = l2 ++ r2 -> {m : list X | l1 ++ m = l2 /\ r1 = m ++ r2} + {m : list X | l2 ++ m = l1 /\ r2 = m ++ r1}
